lines.text: AK-47. The very best there is. When you absolutely, positively got to kill every motherfucker in the room, accept no substitutes.
My ass may be dumb, but I ain't no dumbass.
[after shooting Louis]
What the fuck happened to you, man? Shit, your ass used to be beautiful!
Half a million dollars will always be missed.
I'll bet, besides maybe an afro, you look exactly how you did at 29.
Well, my ass ain't the same.
Bigger?
Yeah.
Ain't nothin' wrong with that!
Who's that?
That's Beaumont.
Who's Beaumont?
An employee I had to let go.
What'd he do?

He put himself in a position where he was going to have to do ten years in prison, that's what he did. And if you know Beaumont, you know ain't no god damn way he can do ten years. And if you know that, then you know Beaumont's gonna do anything Beaumont can to keep from doing them ten years, including telling the federal government any and every motherfucking thing about my black ass. Now that my friend is a clear cut case of him or me. And you best believe it ain't gonna be me.
You can't trust Melanie but you can trust Melanie to be Melanie.
Shut your raggedy-ass up, and sit the fuck down!
How'd you find me?
Winston found you.
How the fuck did he find me?
That's what Winston does. He finds people who don't want to be found.
Well bully for that nigga!
[Melanie and Louis are fighting over a bag of Ordell's money]
Gimme the bag...
Watch it dipshit, you wanna rip the fucking bag.
Gimme that bag before I knock you out and take it.
Okay take it. Jesus, what's wrong with you?
I'm carrying it.
Okay, you got it. Just take a chill pill for Christ's sake.
Fuck you and your chill pill!
Look, I hate to be the kinda nigga does a nigga a favor, then, BAM!, hits a nigga up for a favor in return. But I'm afraid I gots to be that kinda nigga.
Whatchu mean?
I need a favor, nigga!
Goddamn girl, you gettin' high already? It's just 2 o'clock!

[chuckling]
It's that late?
You know you smoke too much of that shit, that shit gonna rob you of your own ambition.
Not if your ambition is to get high and watch TV...
Oh, ya'll a couple Cheech and Chongs, huh?
[phone rings]
Well don't get up, I got it.
Shit, Jackie. You come in this place on Saturday night I bet you need nigger repellant to keep motherfuckers off your ass.
Melanie?
Jackie?
Hey, girl, what's up?
Hey, are you getting that suit?
Yeah. You like it?
It looks really good on you.
You got something for me?
You betcha.
I put a cherry on top. Booh-yah! What the fuck did Ordell ever do for us, huh?
Thanks.
Hey, where's Melanie?

Well... that's what I want to tell you. She was being such a pain. She made us late for the pickup because she locked herself in your bathroom for hours with her bong getting high. She was nagging and complaining... so strung out. She wouldn't shut up, so...
You left her back there?
Not exactly. I shot her.
You shot Melanie?
Twice.
Is she dead?
[Louis does not reply]
Is she dead, yes or no?
Pretty much.
I'm still scared as a motherfucker, O.D. They talking like they serious as hell giving me time for that machine gun shit.
Aw, come on, man, they just trying to put a fright in your ass.
Well, if that's what they doin', they done did it.
How old is that machine gun shit?
About three years...
Three years? That's a old crime, man! They ain't got enough room for all the niggas running around killing people today, now how are they gonna find room for you?
Man, you must be out of your fuckin' mind if you think I'm gonna get in this dirty-ass trunk.
We ain't going nowhere but to Koreatown, man. You ain't gonna be locked in here no more than ten minutes.
I ain't ridin' in no trunk for no minute, man.
[Louis has forgotten where he parked]

Jesus, but if you two are not the biggest pair of fuck-ups I've ever met in my entire life. How did you ever rob a bank? When you robbed banks, did you forget where your car was then too? No wonder you went to jail.
You know, a good cop will never let you know he knows you're full of shit.
[Louis and Melanie are looking at a picture]
That's Japan.
Uh, looks like... I can... It shows...
Wanna fuck?
Yeah.
[three minutes later]
That was fun.
Yeah, that hit the spot.
Now, we can catch up.
Yeah.
[heavy breathing]
Got a beer?
Sure. In the fridge.
I just ain't getting in no goddamn, dirty-ass trunk man. I got a problem with small places.
Well I got a problem with spending ten thousand dollars on ungrateful, peanut-head niggas to get 'em out of jail, but I did it!
[as Max Cherry exits the bathroom]
Uh uh uh... I didn't hear you wash your hands.
I'm serious as a heart attack.
Is that what I think it is?
What do you think it is?
I think it's a gun pressed up against my dick.
Well, you thought right. Now take your hands off from around my throat, nigga.
we go in there, and that nigga Winston or anybody else is in there, you the first motherfucker to get shot. You understand?
What the fuck you doin' knockin on the door like the goddamn police? You wanna die?
I thought you might be asleep.
You keep fuckin' with me, you're gonna be asleep forever.
Aw, the milk went bad while I was in jail.
Black's fine.
I'm 56 years old. I can't blame anybody for anything I do.
Hey, we gotta go! We're late! Come on, Mel! We gotta go! Let's go!
Hey, kiss my ass, fuck wad!
[Ray Nicolet and Jackie Brown are discussing Ordell Robbi's business]
He sells guns.
You ever see him sell guns?
No.
Then how do you know he sells guns?
He told me. Besides, why else would an ATF man be after him?
the most popular gun in American crime. Like they're actually proud of that shit.
Now sooner or later, they're gonna get around to offering me a plea deal, and you know that. That's why you came here to kill me.
I ain't come here to kill you...
No, no, it's OK, it's OK, now. I forgive you.
Jackie can tell me any story that comes into her pretty little head, just so long as at the end of that story she hands me my motherfucking money.
I don't have to know what I'm doing, just so long as you know.
I think I do. Good enough?
You bet.
Jackie wants to give it to you herself, she wants to collect her ten percent. She also wants to explain why she had to hang on to it.
Oh, and I want to hear that shit!

[Ordell has bailed Beaumont out of jail]
Look at you and your free ass. Come here, boy, gimme a motherfuckin' hug.
Good lookin' out, man. I don't know what to say. Thank you, thank you...
Uh-huh. Who was there for your ass?
You were there for my ass.
Who?
You.
Who?
You!
Whooo?
You nigga, damn!
you get your ass in trouble, I get your ass out. That's my motherfuckin' job. And I don't mind telling you, nigga, it's steady work.

[Phone rings]
Bail bonds.
Yeah, Max there?
He ain't here right now, man.
Well, where he at? Out of town?
He's AROUND, man.
Well, gimme his home number.
No, I'll give you his BEEPER number.
All right. Break off the beeper number, nigga.

Well, I've flown seven million miles. And I've been waiting on people almost 20 years. The best job I could get after my bust was Cabo Air, which is the worst job you can get in this industry. I make about sixteen thousand, with retirement benefits that ain't worth a damn. And now with this arrest hanging over my head, I'm scared. If I lose my job I gotta start all over again, but I got nothing to start over with. I'll be stuck with whatever I can get. And that shit is scarier than Ordell.
If you've got time, you think you can find out where he's staying?
Cops can't locate him, huh?
They don't have your winning personality.
See, that shit works my nerves, you being all buddy-buddy with that motherfucker.
If I wasn't so buddy-buddy with that motherfucker, none of this would work.
[last lines]
I'll send you a postcard.
Will you?
I sure will partner.
[They kiss. Both are silent for a moment after, then the phone begins to ring. Max hesitates to answer it]
You're running a business Max.

[answers phone]
Cherry Bail Bonds. Uh, What is it your son's charged with?
[Jackie leaves the office, Max watches her go]
Yes, that's a very serious offense. Is your son still in school? Does his father still live in the house? Could I excuse myself? Would you call me back in about half an hour? Yes, thank you.
[Hangs up the phone and watches Jackie drive off out the window]
Hey, keep your fucking mouth shut, all right? I mean it not one fucking word!
Okay, Louis...
[Louis pulls a gun and shoots Melanie twice]

[Sits in silence for a few moments, thinking, then finally realizes who stole his money]
It's Jackie Brown.
Well, if she got to it, why didn't she take it all?
I'll be sure to ask that bitch before I blow her brains out.
Goddamn girl, how you live like this?
Like what?

[points at filthy room]
Like this! This some repugnant shit!
I'd say you're in the drug business, except the money's moving in the wrong direction.
What's the matter, haven't ever borrowed someone's car before?
Not after they're dead.
And let me tell you something about my lawyer. This brother's name is Stassen Gowens.
...the money won't convict him, guns will.
You're rationalizing.
Well that's what you do to go through with the shit you start, you rationalize. I can do it, Max, I know I can. I just can't do it without you.

Now, the thing is, I ain't never done business with these Koreans before. Now I ain't worried, because, by and large, Asians are very dependable, they don't want no trouble. You might argue with them about price and shit, but you don't need to worry about them shooting you in the back, you know what I'm saying?
Is white guilt supposed to make me forget that I run a business?
Girl, don't make me put my foot in your ass.
[exhales smoke, heavy coughing]
You ok?
Just... gettin' old.
[continues coughing]
Seems I can't smoke all that now without coughing.

Coughing's good! It opens up the capillaries. You know, when you cough you're pulling in air, or in this case - smoke, into parts of the lungs that don't normally get used. So, coughing's good, it gets you higher.
Definitely know a lot about that! Look here Louis, I got to run out for a little while so uh, if you like gettin high so much, why don't you hang out here with Mel' n' watch a little TV.
Way ahead of ya.
See I get high later on when I come back, see I get high at NIGHT, when I get through with all my business.
Cut to 13 years later, you're 44 years of age. You're flying for the shittiest-little-shuttle-fucking piece of shit Mexican airline that there is.

I got this young nineteen year old country girl named Sheronda. I found her on a bus stop two days outta Georgia, barefoot, country as a chicken coop. I took her to my place in Compton, told her it was Hollywood.
She believed you?
Hell yeah! To her dumb country ass, Compton is Hollywood; closest she's ever been anyway.
When did you get ouf of jail?
Four days ago.
Where at?
Susanville.
How long?
Two months shy of four years.
Four years?
Uh huh.
What for?
Bank robbery.
Really? Shit, I'm impressed.
Try not to tear his clothes off, OK? They're new.
Look man, there's only three reasons why you can't make your court date. One, you're in a hospital. Two, you're in jail. Three, your ass is dead.
This you and me talking, is this like a lawyer-client thing, and you can't repeat nothing I tell you?
You're not my client until you get busted and I bond you out.
Well, if we ain't got no - what's that shit called? - confidentiality, why should I tell you a thing?
Because you want me to know what a slick guy you are. You got stewardesses bringing you fifty grand.
Now why would a stewardess be bringing me fifty grand?

Now you want me to speculate on what you do. My guess is you're in the drug business, except the money's moving the wrong way. Whatever you're into, you seem to be getting away with it, so more power to you.
Yeah.
There ain't nothing you want to tell me before we get out of this car, is there?
No.
Last chance, motherfucker. You sure?
[Max nods]
You better be, motherfucker. All right, let's roll.
Yeah, woman, damn!

[on Melanie]
I just felt strange, you know, I thought, if she was your girlfriend...
But you fucked her anyway?
Well...
Well, I hope you felt appropriately guilty about it afterwards.
Afterwards, I did.
[They both laugh]

[Speaking on the phone to Mr. Walker in Mexico]
Come on man! If it wasn't for me, you wouldn't HAVE that motherfuckin' boat!

[Listening to Mr. Walker's response]
Oh, yeah, yeah, right. I'm seein' who my motherfuckin' friends are right... Hello? Hello?

[Staring at the phone in his hand]
Motherfucker hung up on me. You believe this shit? Ingrate nigga! See? You bring a motherfucker up. Next thing you know, they breakin' ya off some goddamned disrespect. Motherfuck. Shit.
Somebody with a grudge blew Beaumont's brains out. Oh shit, that shit rhymes! "Blew Beau-mont's, brains out!"
I got some "for-your-eyes-only" shit to show you.
[Jackie and Ordell need accomplices for the money exchange]
So I sit down at the table, eat my food, then your girl comes along. Oh, you have anybody yet?
Yeah, I got someone.
Who?
What you care?
What I care is my ass facing the penitentiary. If you send some hard-headed rock whore up in here...
Hey, hey, hey, hey. She ain't gonna be no "rock ho." She gonna be cool. Promise.
[first lines]
Flight 710 to Cabo San Lucas, now boarding Gate 103, first class only. Flight 710, Cabo San Lucas, now boarding Gate 103. First class only.

[greeting passengers]
Buenos dias. Welcome aboard. Welcome aboard.
Man, you catch a nigga off-guard with this shit.
Ordell, this isn't a bar. You don't have a tab.
What's your drink brother?
Let me have a screwdriver homes.
And what about you?
Oh, I'm fine.
Yes you are
[they all laugh, the bartender leaves]
Goddamn, girl, you come in here on a Saturday night, I bet you need nigga repellent to keep them motherfuckers off your ass.
You've no idea what happened to the 50,000 dollars. You're clueless about the money, right? You've no idea about the 50 grants.
I have no idea.
Not... You've no idea? You don't know?
Nuthin', no.
Could have gone here? Could have gone there?
No, no. I don't know.
You don't know? No clue? You're clueless.
I know nothin. Not a clue!
No idea?
I don't have an idea where the mothafuckin' money is.
Not even a little idea? Maybe?
Not even... Not even a little tiny motherfucking idea.
[repeated line]
I can do that.
Louis, Louis, Louis. You gon' tell me who you saw?
Yeah, Max Cherry.
Max Che...
[Ordell sighs audibly]

You seen Max Cherry in the dress department where we... Man look at me when I'm talking to you! You see that mutha f**ka in the dress department when we bout to get a half million dollas and you don't think nothin' bout him being there?
No, why? They know each other?
Hell yeah they know each others he bonded her outta county.
How am I supposed to know that?
You know he's a bail bondsman don'tcha? You know all them mutha f**kas is crooked as a barrel 'a snakes don'tcha?
Why should I think somethings weird if I don't know nothing about them knowing each other.
I don't wanna hear no f**kin excuses Louis!
I ain't givin' you f**kin excuses. Man I'm tellin' you I don't f**kin... I'm giving you f**kin reasons.
Oh oh oh oh. You gon' tell me the reason you lost every god**** cent I got in the world?
Hey. Hey man.
You gon' tell me reasons?
You better...
Let me tell you the reason mutha f**ka. The reason IS yo' a** ain't worth a sh*t no mo'.
You better f**kin back off man.

[POP! Ordell shoots Louis]
What the f**k happened to you man? Yo' ass used to be beautiful.
